messages.title: David's plan to save local people £700
messages.content: Under Liberal Democrat plans backed by local campaigners David Schmitz, local residents could save on their council tax bills. David is calling for income tax to be scrapped on the first £10,000 that people earn.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans to raise the income tax threshold to £10,000 could save local residents on council tax bills.
An additional £2.5 billion funding is proposed for schools.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Invest in a green and sustainable economy
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Leaflet implies an investment in sustainability but does not provide details.
There is an intention to enact reforms to clean up politics.

issues.economy: Tax reforms to save local residents on their council tax bills.
issues.education: Additional £2.5 billion in funding for schools is being proposed.
issues.environment: Investment in a green and sustainable economy.

housing.content: Save local residents on their council tax bills.

politicalExperience.achievements: David Schmitz is shown campaigning with two other councillors; however, his specific achievements are not listed.

quotes.text: Labour disarray helps put Lib Dems on cusp of power
Haringey Council allowed a second 'Baby Peter' case to occur more than a year after the first

images.caption: David Schmitz and councillors campaigning in Harringay & St Ann's

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet criticized the performance of Haringey Council and promoted the Liberal Democrats' agenda for change. There are references to the Liberal Democrats' broader national policies, as well as specific criticism of Labour and Conservative MPs.
